result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the Final Pretrial.  Parties are to check for witness availability for this scheduled trial date and inform the Court of any problems.

copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Glenn P Haake appeared by video, in custody, Attorney William A Demet appeared in court for Glenn P Haake. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on January 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
